review: Had a great dinner here. We're vegetarian and loved that we had so many options. The waitress was very helpful and suggested a Mexican pizza (forgot name) replacing the chicken with avocado and it was surprisingly very flavourful! Also shared a garlic Alfred fettuccine and Buffalo cauliflower. Both were delicious. The cauliflower was nice and spicy. Tasted a bit like  cauliflower Manchurian (Indo Chinese dish). Overall great experience.

Deserved zero stars.  Went on Veterans Day (bad decision, when the food is free you get what you pay for) at 9:15, 45 min before closing.  We were seated right away. However, we were seated next to a pile of dirty dishes which sat until the food came.  All the staff was busy cleaning up elsewhere so we waited almost 10min for someone to take our order.  We ordered as soon as she came - two pizzas and 2 waters. After another 10 minutes I went to the bar to get the water since they were all busy cleaning.  One of the kitchen staff had to get the bartender's attention since he was busy cleaning the bar (it's about 9:35 at this point, 25 min before closing) The pizzas come about 5 min later.  The wife's looks good, nicely browned, bubbled crust.  Mine was shoved in the oven and not touched: one side brown with a burn bubble and the other flat and raw looking: think "freezer pizza" Of course she goes back to cleaning because, why waste time with customers, especially since they aren't paying?  I took a couple of bites of one piece and left the rest.  When she came back she offered to make another one - I had been there over half an hour at that point and it was within 15 minutes of closing so I declined. I go to the one at Oakbrook Mall and it's usually good.  I would never set foot in this CPK again.  If they are going to offer Veterans Day specials they should at least treat the customers with the minimum respect they would give anyone else, otherwise don't offer them.

I have been going toCalifornia Pizza Kitchens for a long time.  I went to lunch with my daughter and a friend of ours.  We were very disappointed with the food as it has gone downhill in taste and quality.  But we were SHOCKED at how expensive the food has become.  I had a full Cobb salad and my daughter had the BLT pizza. It was dry and boring.  My salad was just shy of $16.00 and her pizza around $15.00!  We both also had ice tea.  The bill came to $40.00 with tax and with tip close to $50.00!!! . Holy cow.  $50.00 for two ice teas, pizza and a salad.  They must not be doing well to charge that much for mediocre food ;(.   I also must give credit to a really nice and efficient waitress that made dining there a semi pleasant experience.

This used to be a great place to have a casual meal.  For year's we've always shared the original bbq chicken chopped salad and then had a specialty pizza The ambiance is still good as is service.  The food quality however has severely deteriorated and prices have risen The chicken chopped salad was mostly a pile of lettuce with minimal dressing and we paid near $20 for this.  I had to ask someone to bring us a cup of dressing so the "lettuce" could be edible We shared the Hawaiian pizza which had was lacking in cheese and any flavor whatsoever Certainly a shame because this restaurant used to be so much better.  Raising prices and worsening the food quality certainly seems like the wrong direction for CPK

This place is a joke.  1. They are way overpriced for what you get 2. Their food is laughable at best.  3. They can't get large orders right. TAKE NOTE CPK: If I'm to pay $15 for a Wild Mushroom pizza, INCLUDE A LOT OF MUSHROOMS!! Don't give me this paper thin pizza with a quarter cup of cheese and an 1/8 cup of mushrooms. Pathetic and shame on you!! I gave you another chance and the second time I tried a grilled veggie sandwich.  TAKE NOTE CPK: If I'm to pay $15 for a grilled veggie sandwich and mediterranean sandwich, INCLUDE A LOT OF GRILLED VEGGIES!! Don't take two slivers of NOT GRILLED yellow pepper and a half of a NOT GRILLED mushroom and top it with a half pound of lettuce.   Wow CPK, can you chince your customers anymore? Do you need donations to help sustain your business?How about if I give you $20 for a grilled sandwich? Think maybe you guys could give me at least a half of a yellow bell pepper and a full mushroom and actually grill them this time?

There is one good server here Eddie is great I wish he could be my server every time I come here. The rest of the staff is disorganized and repeated forgets thing I just had 5 different people ask if I wanted a refill. I said no every time but no one took my drink. There is also I high rate of turnover here.  Update more turn over all new staff. The fired the best servers. And they can't seem to get orders done correctly now or in a timely manner. I sadly won't be back after years of going there once a week.

Paid $50 for the server to get one of our drinks wrong (it was just me and my boyfriend so it wasn't some giant order), for a teeny tiny bowl of shrimp scampi pasta that was finished in under 5 minutes, and fish tacos that tasted like cardboard drizzled with ranch. I was told that this place was amazing but I'm sad to say I'm very disappointed. Only giving it 2 stars because what little pasta we were given was very good.

Eh the service and food was sub par at this location. We had to wait a while to get refill on or sodas. It was not busy, and they had plenty of servers, but our server was busy serving and asking others then us. Me and the misses both had a great time together, the food was ok, but the service ehh. I don't think I will go to location any time soon. Food 3/5 Service 2/5 Atmosphere 2/5

Never coming back. I work in customer service, normally I am pretty patient with people, especially in the restaurant business. This time.. i was not. Refills took forever, bread took forever, food took forever. Not to mention the restaurant was empty... maybe 3 other tables. It took 30 minutes after we were done eating for our server to finally come back and ask us how we were doing. Ridiculous! I was done eating for at least 20 minutes and i had an impatient 3 year old with me.... Will not be returning to this location. Very disapppointed.

I placed an order online for two pizzas and chose to pick them up with the "curbside" option. The order went through and I got an email a few seconds later confirming my order and saying the pizzas would be ready in 20 minutes. I live about 15-20 minutes away from this location, so I got in the car and drove over to make sure I showed up in time. Upon arrival, I called into the restaurant as I was instructed to do from my confirmation email. I told the employee who answered the phone that I was waiting in one of the Curbside Pick-Up parking spots outside. She said someone would be out promptly. Twenty minutes later, no food, so I call back in and the same employee answered the phone and said someone "would be out promptly." Another employee came out a few seconds later and confirmed my order. I asked her what took so long and she said the employee who answered the phone "got busy and forgot." Nice excuse. Pretty sure I can't use that at my job. She went to get the pizzas, came back out to my car and her exact words were,"Well......that doesn't look like how they USUALLY make it!" and this was in reference to the spicy chipotle chicken pizza I had ordered. At this point, I'm annoyed that I've waited 20 minutes, and one of my pizzas isn't "how they usually make it." So, I asked the employee if I can just have my money back. She avoided the question and said she was going to run inside and get the sauce for my pizza. Umm..excuse me? The pizza doesn't even have the right SAUCE on it? Okay...  She comes back out with the sauce and I go home. With the chicken pizza, I specifically ordered it to come without poblano peppers. With the first bite, I noticed they were on there.... For $30+ for two pizzas, I could have definitely had a better meal somewhere else with far better service and less hassle. Never again.

Food was fine but the server spilled three full drinks all over two of our dining party and although he apologized, management did not come over to see how we were. When a manager did come over, it was so long into the meal that their clothing was almost dry (they don't have hand dryers in the bathroom so they had to air dry in the restaurant) and he didn't mention the incident or apologize at all just the normal how are you drive by. Oh and nothing off our bill either. Don't know that we will return to this location again (family of five).

Terrible service. Took forever to get water and bread basket. We had to wait another 20 minutes to get our drinks. Mistakes were made with our order, and, worst of all, the pizzas were cold! The restaurant was not busy, but our waitress was nowhere to be seen. After we finished eating, we had to wait another 20 minutes for the bill, with a cranky baby. This used to be a much better place. Wonder what happened!

4 stars only because tables were sticky and my margarita wasn't blended enough. Haha......But the service was AWESOME! Will, our server was great! His attentiveness, wittiness and upbeat attitude was very refreshing. Thanks!

The food is really good and the service is amazing our waitress was really helpful and nice. The bartender even taught us how to make a drink. The chefs did a good job on the food and the manager kept everything going great!!!

So I had a really horrible experience here last night but I've had perfectly fine experiences in the past, but never exceptional experiences, so I think two stars is where CPK lands in my book. My husband I were starving and he felt like CPK, a place I would frequent in junior high when cruising Oakbrook mall with my besties. The one out here on Diehl is well positioned across the street from the world's BEST Target, and in front of an enormous movie theater. The interior is bright and nice and the service is fine, but last night, we wanted takeout. CPK has online ordering (YES!) and curbside pickup (HELL YES!) and we scanned the menu with glee to pick out our choices. I noticed that a LOT of the menu items had truffle oil on them(I'm severely allergic to truffles), but the pizza we chose did not, so I didn't think twice about it and moved on.  We picked up our food and a delightful young lady brought it out to us promptly. Upon arriving home, we saw we were missing our appetizer. Annoying, but they credited our bill and still let my husband go pick it up, so forgivable. I had a slice of pizza and it was delicious. Then I went for a second slice and smelled... Truffle oil. Oh god, I thought. Is it on every slice? It's not supposed to be on this pizza at all! I put the slice back down and waited. Terrified. An hour later, fears confirmed: I was sicker than sick. I'm fine now, but yikes. Don't sneak weird ingredients that can make people barf on to pizza, please. In conclusion, I won't be going back to CPK, but you probably should. Unless you're allergic to items that shouldn't be on the pizza. Ugh.

Super vegetarian friendly menu! Also some certified gluten free items. Manager said they pride themselves on being "safe" for gluten free people. Buffalo cauliflower is addictive! Allison is a great sever. Ask for her.

This rating is for the overall experience of a handful of visits over the past couple of years.  The food is decent and they're often implementing specials to keep it interesting and portions are decent.   It's a little pricey, but the quality of the ingredients are good and this is a step up from other sit down pizza chains.    What sets this location apart is service-every time, the waitstaff and roaming management are very friendly, and they hustle to refill drinks, get your order right and ensure you're happy.

I love CPK and I've always been to the one in oakbrook, but I've been to the warrenville a couple times to pick up and they're ridiculous. The first time they forgot half my food. And the second time some of the people who work there are rude and disrespectful. I am not going there again. The hostile environment is so unwelcoming, although the food is delicious I'm never going back.

Quality is not what it should be. Pizza was not prepared well. Salad tasted old. Service was lacking. Asked for the manager, he was nonchalant about it somewhat. Disappointed, brought my wife here for a b-day lunch.

One of my favorite pizza places. Dine in or take out the pizzas are great!  They offer other pasta dishes and salads also.  The mushroom ravioli is great and my favorite pizzas include the BBQ Hawaiian pizza and the Sicilian pizza.   The cocktails are fun and they have a full bar.  Prices are a bit pricey for pizzas, but for an individual pizza it can be split into 2 meals.  .... I do admit I can eat a whole pizza in one sitting :)

I had the salmon and it ranged from the consistency of dry chicken to salmon jerky.  The person I went with had pasta and it was under-cooked. One thing I liked was a small portion of the menu actually had the calorie counts of the meals.

CPK has been the go to for fresh, great food. I do a ton of pick up ordering. Staff is always friendly and helpful. The other night they were late in getting my food ready (15 minutes past the expected ready time). The staff was very apologetic as they were clearly slammed and had mistakenly given an aggressive ready time. I was only 5 minutes into driving home after getting the food when I received a call from the staff informing me they had comped my meal because we waited so long. I've NEVER had a restaurant do that. Ever. Despite being late in getting me my food, that classy move just got them a loyal customer. Thanks CPK!

I went to CPK for the first time a few weeks ago. It was a slow Monday night and we were celebrating a friend's birthday. The pizza was delicious--- ingredients tasted fresh, cheese was amazing. I would give it  3.5 stars. However, the service was horrible. I'm giving this restaurant 2 stars because the server never bothered to refill our waters and he was basically MIA after giving us our food. I have worked as a server so I would say I have pretty fair expectations. When the restaurant is empty, there is NO EXCUSE for bad service.
Frequent diner at this location. The staff remember your name and the food is yummy.

Why am I writing a review for CPK? Just so you have an idea next time you check out the California Pizza Kitchen: We started our meal with the LETTUCE WRAPS - what a great little appetizer. Four lettuce leaf/shell's, and a diced chicken filling.Perfect for the four person party we were dining with. I always get pizza. BBQ chicken never fails. A great tasting non-traditional pizza. The crust and dough is really soft, which goes well with non-traditional pizza flavor. My girlfriend got the Broccoli Rabe, Sun-dried Tomato fusilli. She loves this dish for the simplicity and taste. Our friends go Jambalaya (blackened shrimp and grilled chicken tossed with noodles!), and the Thai Crunch Salad (it looks so tasty with all of the crispy wonton strips). We didn't get dessert this time - but last time we got a slice of the Red-Velvet cake and it was really fabulous. Sounds crazy, that CPK would have such good red-velvet cake, but it was perfect. The one drawback about this trip was the number of children eating at 9pm on a Saturday night. This speaks more about the clientele than the restaurant, but just to let yo know who you could be eating with. Who goes to CPK? Folks looking for a solid meal. There is almost something for everyone (the only things missing are like steaks and chops). Prices are reasonable and the waits usually aren't that bad. Who doesn't go to CPK? People who want a more intimate dining experience (i.e. no kids shouting at 9pm) People who want high-class dining. CPK is fancy pizza, not fancy food

The interior of this place reminds me of my favorite breakfast place in St. Louis, The Parkmoor.  That's gone now, but at least I can reminisce at the CPK!  The interior here is like a diner with the booths and a counter you can eat at.  You don't feel so crammed in, even when it is busy. We ate the pizza here and of course it was good.  I did NOT like the appetizer prices.  $9 for spinach artichoke dip!  It was not a hearty portion. Our server was nice, but was kind of rushing us.  We couldn't figure out why, there wasn't a wait or anything.  He kept trying to take my dishes and I had to keep telling him I was still eating. But the goat cheese pizza was really yummy, so I'll go back.

I really only come here because it's tough to find a pizza place that serves pizza individually.  The pizza is OK, it's almost unremarkable to forgettable.  But if i'm craving pizza for lunch, I have to get my fix.  The service is always good, and the managers have no problem refilling drinks themselves in case the staff is busy at the time.  The service pushes this from a 2 star to a 3 star review.

This was my first visit to this location and it was excellent.  We had two people that have never been to California Pizza Kitchen before and they were impressed.  I recommend the Chicken Chowder, and the Pear Gorgonzola pizza. The Applewood Sangria is also great. I had never heard of a Sangria Margarita before today, sounded good, but a little too strong for me. LOL

My husband and I stopped in for a Saturday lunch. They were doing a good business. Our server, Becky, was friendly and personable. She reviewed new items for appetizers or small plate sharing. I had not been to a CPK in over 20 years. We skipped the obvious and did not order pizza as we like good old fashioned pizza. We both ordered pasta dishes. My husband had the garlic cream fettucine with shrimp and chicken and I ordered the kung pao spaghetti with shrimp. Both of us were very pleased with our choices. The pasta was cooked al dente as it should be and the sauces were flavorful. I asked for mine extra spicy and was given a dish of hot sauce to spice it up to the level I like. The shrimp in both dishes were cooked to perfection and tasted fresh, not frozen. We left there very pleased and will likely return to try the tacos and new appetizers.

I usually don't get all exact about my stars but this is an instance where I can't stop clicking.  Three...four...three...where the 3.5 when you need it? For what it is, a chain restaurant you can find just about anywhere, it's decent.  Tonight I had the penna with sausage, peppers and marinara sauce and I have to say the spices were pretty well done.  What I really enjoy about it is the kid-friendly atmosphere that includes better-prepared kid meals.  They do not have ketchup bottles on the table (or in the kitchen).  The chicken is grilled, not of the chicken finger variety.  I might get the kid's mac & cheese for myself next time.  Oh, and childrens' meals come with broccoli or grapes - well done Mr. Pizza Kitchen! I like the dining room at this site much better than the dinny Oak Brook location.

My first time at any CPK and i loved it.... Got Chipotle chicken pizza and Tortilla Spring rolls....Service was very good and attentive....A very cute hostess took care of us and was very courteous too.... Luckily not many people were in the restaurant so got our food pretty quick and loved every bite of it..... Ambience was ver good too...Best thing are they are very organized....moment they show u table , they give u the name of person who is gonna take care of you....Would definitely recommend this place..

The pizzas may be pricey but you can get a whole wheat crust. Try the Pear Walnut salad for a sinfully delightful plate of greens. Their vegetarian soup is excellent and so is the hummus plate - again ask for them to make the pitas with the wheat crust - they can and will do it.

Sadly, the closest I can get to California Pizza Kitchen in Pittsburgh is the Target frozen food section, but when I make my way westward this is on my list of places to stop. I f'love the way the place looks (blonde wood, natural stone, brushed chrome, pendant lights, wood beam ceilings) and I suppose on some level I'm prejudiced by the fact that the few times I've been there I've unexpectedly gotten the same waitress who is also from da 'Burgh. :)  Aesthetics and great service aside the food is great. Recommendations -  * Avocado Club Egg Rolls - appetizer schmapetizer, make this your lunch! * for dinner try the Chicken Piccata, Portabello Mushroom Ravioli, or a signature pizza, such as, BBQ Chicken, Milan, or Cajun. (If you have a large group order several different pizzas and sample a bit of each). I haven't a clue if their fusion style eats are truly 'Californian', but it makes my mouth happy and that's all I care about.

Evary time i go i always get the same server, Bryan.   He is probably the best server  i have ever had. So if you go, ask for him. The food is your typical CPK, nothing super special about our naperville one.  But it's really nice for a quick  lunch.  Never have had dinner there, but i would imagine the menu and service is the same. Enjoy your pizza.

I've dined at a number of CPK restaurants, this one was just as good as the others, but twice as pretty.  This had a more airy, spread-out feeling than most.  Everything I've ever gotten there has been predictable, but quite good.  This one offers "curbside service," meaning that if you call ahead with a meal "to go,"  you don't even have to get out of your big-ass SUV, a server will bring your food (and payment system) out to you. One star off because my kids got sundaes for dessert and the hot fudge melted the ice cream into soup.

Always great service, great quality and a great time.  Everything I have ever had there is delicious from the hummus to the mouth-watering pizzas and finishing with the dedicate desserts.  Definitely a must-eat!

I'm not a fan of any of their 2000 locations world wide. On that note I'll review the staff, and they are nice and well experienced. So if you're a fan of CPK, this is a great location. Way way better then the staff at the Oak Brook location, so I'd make the trip to this one.

Generally have great experience.  I must admit I don't go for the pizzas. I go for the salads. My husband usually gets some off the wall pizza . I get the barbecue chicken salad. My daughter likes it there and enjoys the food. No battles at this place.
This wasn't my first visit to this location but everytime has been quite good. The service is always excellent and the food delicious.

This is one of the more beautifully appointed locations for CPK that I've been to. The decor is a lovely upgraded 60's lounge with warm and earth tones that totally hit me as an awesome date location. The food is always ok to good at CPK, so no big surprises need be expected. Servers seem automated androids sometimes, but that's just ranked up to job satisfaction and not your fault. CPK recently added a couple of new items such as a mediterranean salad with hummus  and feta (protein) and a lovely variety of greens, served with a side of pita -- reminiscent of their cannellini hummus appetizer but in a salad form. The wild mushroom pizza has a lovely garlic and wild mushroom taste that's hard to find elsewhere. One very good point going for CPK is that they price their drinks on the drink/appetizer menu. Kudos!

I love their salads, which is funny because I'm a total carb-a-holic and it's crazy that I don't order pizza here. It's just that so rarely I find a good salad, made with fresh greens, veggies & cheeses, chopped and tossed the right way. CPK does this right, and for that, I am willing to pay $10-13 for a good salad. They have so many varieties. I love their Waldorf, Thai crunch, BBQ chopped & regular chopped salads. They offer them in 1/2 or full portions, and the 1/2 is perfect as a regular meal or to split with a couple friends before your meal.  Their pizza is also good, but I'm a Chicago deep-dish or authentic Italian pizza fan, so I rarely get pizza here. Some of my friends and I have been coming here since high school, and they always get the same pizzas. There is a BLT pizza!  One thing I must say, though, is that sometimes the service is a little cray cray. This one time, my girlfriend and I had this obnoxious waiter that made us very uncomfortable. He stayed too long, awkwardly chatting it up, rarely leaving us time to chat with one another. Then when we needed to pay our bill and get our food wrapped, he was nowhere to be found. The next time I visited CPK, I had a darling waitress who was delightful and very professional. I think it's just hit or miss!

Hadn't been to a CPK in at least 12 years. Didn't miss them and never turned back. After today, though, I'm happy to have tried them again. There were 5 of us, and we were splitting a whole slew of things. The dumpling appetizers were good, as were the egg rolls with lots of avocado and bacon, which were even better. The harvest salad was surprisingly ultra fresh and delish, with lots of candied pecans, fruit, field greens, cranberries gorgonzola cheese. The best pizza and the one I would order again is the extra thin artichoke, spinach and chicken pizza. With a generous helping of these 3 ingredients and both mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese, that was an awesome pizza. While a pasta dish was good and the meat-lovers pizza was hearty and tasty, this was the best entrée/pizza. Service was fantastic, our waiter kept up with all the drink and water refills as much as the alcoholic drinks. Couldn't really ask for more!

The service is better than the food. Understanding that California does not have good pizza, CPK has better pizza than what you'd get in the actual state. But they could still use more sauce. A lot more sauce. If you're eating BBQ Chicken Pizza, you should be able to at least taste the BBQ sauce. All pizzas are 6-slice 10" thick crust. You can have thin crust for an extra $1.50, which makes no sense that you pay more for less dough. The low price appetizers do kinda make up for the ridiculous price increase for thin crust pizza. Got 4 fried mac and cheese bites for $3.75. They were overcooked, but I like that. Would just be better with a tastier cheese, but for $3.75, can't really complain. Better cheese would probably increase the price. The location is gorgeous. I like that there's a regular door for handicapped patrons instead of the revolving door (would be too dangerous to use a revolving door whether on crutches or in a wheelchair). But the seperate door is very heavy. It would be great if they had buttons for automatic opening so a handicapped customer wouldn't have to depend on an able-bodied person to open the door for them. If I liked the food better, I'd use their Take Out frequently.

This place is very overrated. First of all, the wait time was ridiculous. We had to wait to be seated, the host told us ten minute but it was more like a half hour. Then we were seated and it took a long time for our waiter to come. The waiter creeped me out and wasn't very friendly. Their appetizer menu is very small and they hardly have anything that's Italian, seriously it's a pizza place have something that's italian. I had the white pizza which was good but my boyfriend got the gluten free pizza which he thought tasted terrible. The prices here are outrageous and the food is mediocre.  The red velvet cake was delicious so that's why I gave this place two stars. We will not come back.

I haven't been here forever so I was really looking forward to it but I left rather disappointed. The bread slices have shrunk, they don't bring out any Parmesan cheese or butter to go with anymore (just a dish of olive oil), and the BBQ chicken salad appeared to be completely lacking any jicama. We tried the lettuce wraps but they weren't nearly as good as the ones at Pei Wei. Oh, and when two people are dining would it have killed them to provide four pieces of lettuce instead of only three? Overpriced and underwhelming is my new view of this restaurant. I do rather like the atmosphere of this location but that's not enough to make me want to come back. I will say the hostess was absolutely wonderful and friendly. I wish she had been our server.

WOAH. WOAH. Pros: - I called literally 5 minutes before bringing a huge group of 10 over. Girl on the phone was receptive and pleasant! We were greeted with a smile and had a table ready and waiting! And we're talking 7:30pm on a Saturday! - Server was charismatic, knew his stuff, and had a great attitude. So mad I didn't take down his name -- he was a tall gentleman with blonde hair put in a ponytail. You, sir, are amazing. - Service was attentive, food was super fast, and restaurant was clean with a great atmosphere/ambiance. - The food was holy crap delicious. I had the peach salad with salmon, and a white wine margarita. Probably the best margarita of my life. Cons: - NONE - LITERALLY, NONE I'd also like to mention this was not only my birthday celebration, but my FIRST visit to a California Pizza Kitchen and it was an outstanding one at that. Thanks for making my birthday extra amazing!

This is one chain restaurant that I really like. I've been eating at CPK since it first opened at Oakbrook. Back then they still had roasted garlic shrimp pizza, which to my little kid taste buds was the best thing ever.  Fast forward to my adult years and I still come here for the pizza but I also like their appetizers, salads and entrees.  I always have to have the spinach artichoke dip. It's cheesy, creamy and savory. Probably frozen, heated up and chock full of bad things but you only live once, right? I also tried the fried mac and cheese bites. Pretty good. Can you tell I really like cheese? =) If I'm in a salad mood, I like to order the Waldorf salad with chicken or the Cobb. I love the abundance of ingredients in each salad and the option of ordering either a full or half. For pizzas, I like to order the roasted garlic chicken, wild mushroom or bbq chicken. Yum. When I want to carbo load, I'll order spaghetti bolognese, chicken piccata, or broccoli and sun-dried tomato fusilli.  It's decent food at decent prices.

CPK is a chain I love. Open kitchens since the beginning, you always know what/who touched your food. Their standard crusts are delicious, and with the right pizza the wheat crust is really tasty. But it is the chopped salads that bring me back. The new Morrocan Chicken salad had beets, dates, cranberry, nuts, butternut squash, and all sorts of beautiful color and flavor. The new light bite Korean Beef Tacos were sample and were a tasty surprise.
Always find something yummy to eat here... Service is usually fast and cordial... An easy choice when in a crunch for a god place to eat

Great service! Always able to get seated right away on a weekend both times I've eaten here. Caramelized peach salad w/bacon is amaaaazing! Jerk chick pizza was also surprisingly tasty as well. CPK is very consistent & I've been to several locations but this location in particular offers superb service.

Whether it's margharita pizzas or chicken limone, CPK offers variety. The waldorf salad is my favorite. The service is always quick and attentive, and the food usually doesn't disappoint. I would stay away from the BLT pizza... basically a crust with some bacon strips and shredded lettuce thrown on top. When you see it, it's not too appetizing.

great service... food is just OK... portions are good , but you definitely pay for it!!  The value is very poor... my son ordered the pepperoni pizza... this pizza was no different than Little Caesars for over DOUBLE the price.  My  husband had the Sicilian Lovers, and both of these had hardly any cheese at all!!  Yet, both were priced between $13-$16!! We enjoyed the fresh avocado, corn and bean salsa appetizer... yet when we asked for a few more tortilla chips to finish up the dip, they charged us more. It would have been nice to have more description on the menu for the salad I ordered (BBQ chicken)... the menu just stated BBQ sauce, ranch and cilantro... there were several other things on the actual salad, including cheese, and tortilla strips, both of which I would have eliminated when ordering, to keep it healthier. Overall... this was a very expensive bill for the meal we had.

Wow!  HIGHLY IMPRESSED!  Unbelievable service.  Food was fantastic.  Everything was fresh and the variety of offerings was large.  Restaurant was clean.  Service was incredibly fast for 12:30 lunch on a Friday. I have dined at the Oak Brook location and enjoyed it, but this location was remarkable!  I have a background in restaurant marketing and general advertising--but not with this chain.  I was blown-away at how perfectly they handled everything.  This was a particularly noteworthy experience.  The staff is highly trained.  I was extremely impressed--it was better than a textbook example of how a server and manager should connect with their customers. They did EVERYTHING right. Kudos to the CPK Warrenville team.  You guys nailed it today!  My family will be back!

Gross California Pizza Kitchen, gross.   I went to the restroom and an employee was leaving the stall and did not bother to stop and wash his hands.  When I entered the stall, he had peed all over the seat.   CPK  ==  See Pee K? I pray to every God that none of your filthy peeing without hand washing employees actually touched my food. Never again.  Gross.  Just effing gross.

The tai crunch salad here is addicting! All of the dishes I've ordered here are light but satisfying and don't leave you feeling bloated when you leave (something I hate). Pizzas are thin and delicious, flat breads great, and the lettuce wraps are worthy of trying! To top it all off, the management is very friendly and have their best interest in the customers which sadly is something hard to come across these days.

Didn't get bread until we asked halfway through the meal. Our server was really friendly and helpful though. We went on a Friday at 6pm and it was packed! Took about 25 minutes to get a pizza. Added one star because we got an extra free cheese pizza because the kitchen made doubles of orders!  And the BBQ Chicken Pizza is my favorite.

I love pizza but seldom eat it (carbs). However, there menu choices offer so much more than pizza. I had a Miso and Shrimp Salad that was very good and a refreshing alternative to high carb / high fat choices like pizza. The service for my one and only visit at this location was above average.

We were quite disappointed with this place after our last visit. It took our waiter a long time to come over and greet us and take our drink order. When he brought our drinks he asked if we would like some bread and oil - Yes Please! It never came. Our pizzas were good, but very messy to eat. My husband and I were both looking forward to trying their special new dessert which was advertised on a stand on the table. When we ordered it our waiter said they were all out. Seriously? Did anyone consider taking the picture of it off the tables? Also, we felt everything was really overpriced and the dining room was really loud for lunchtime on a Tuesday. I doubt we will go back.

I've always had nothing but good, tasty food here at CPK.  The service has ranged from decent to great.  The place is chain-y, but at least offers certain kinds of food that other restaurants don't.  I mean yeah, you can get pizza almost anywhere, but this here is fancy-pants pizza! I especially like the avocado egg rolls, tequila-lime fettuccine, and the Santa Fe chicken pizza.  ...all good choices. CPK used to have one of my favorite martinis...the California Cosmo.  It was a cosmo-style drink, but with grape flavors, instead of cranberry.  It was garnished with frozen grapes.  It was clean, crisp, strong, and I just loved it.  They took it off their menu.  *sad face*  I want that drink back!  They do make a good apple martini though...one of the better ones I've ever had. Overall, I'll eat here again from time to time.  Since it's right outside the movie theater, it's an easy choice for me when I want a nice, sit-down meal and I just got out of the movies.

I went with a couple of buddies. We had the Mediterranean spring rolls, the California veggie and the 5 cheese and tomato. The food was really good and filling. The crust was good too. Was a bit overpriced. Our server Sarah, was fast and really nice.

We had a supplier in town and they took us to CPK for lunch today (10/17/2007).  I ordered the "new" Cajun Pizza which has blackened chicken, andouille sausage with a creole sauce, roasted peppers, mild onions with Mozzarella.  It wasn't bad at all.  The meats were tasty and it arrived quickly so for lunch this was a pretty good deal. thank GOD though that I didn't have to pay for this.  The pizza's run about $10-11 here and that's more than I'd spend on lunch for myself usually (once you add in a soda or extras). The restaurant is pretty cool and they offer curbside service if you want to order take out.  We didn't have any appetizers or desserts, so the pizza was all I had.  I'd probably come back here again, since it's close to the office.  Although I've never met a pizza I don't like, the nice thing is that they have so many different kinds of them. They were very accommodating for a vegetarian friend along with us as well as any "special order" where someone wanted a pizza but not a specific item that comes standard on it.

not really pizza in the traditional sense, very fancy weird pies that taste o.k. good salad, good soup. if you are jones-ing for a pizza this is not the place, if you are jones-ing for a foo-foo pie then you hit the right spot! the service is ok, the staff seems to care. the beer is cold. there are too many tables in a too of a small dining room.

this is another place i don't understand the hype??  you get a bland mini pizza, with a couple "exotic" ingredients, and bang, you get to pay west coast prices!  the salads too, totally unimpressive.  the service was good, as was the atmosphere, i do admit that.   here's my advice, don't eat anywhere near the cantera movieplex, a captured audience does not breed good food.  i also got sicker than a dog last time i ate there, pretty sure it was the grilled chicken caesar salad.  uuggh, i still shudder when i think about that place.

Kids like the pizzas - pastas are OK.  Had the lettuce wrap with chicken, a little salty but good.   But the BEST thing at the place is the HOT FUDGE sundae's.  We don't normally order desert, but the kids ordered the kids' size sundae. and it had the CHEWY Hot Fudge, not the chocolate syrup junk.  It's better than the ice cream shops!  Now, we always save room after our meals to order, at least the small sized sundaes.  Good friendly service - they even gave refills on the Italian soda.

I was not a great start. My wife was hungry and so was my mom. When we got to the retaurant my wife got out and walked fast to the restaurant. The door was heavy and the wind was blowing hard, and she pulled the door which jammed against her foot and she as all pissed, ( guess at whom..well me!!!) Then we were seated immediately and ordered the soup. Soup was hot and tasted good. Both the wife and mum loved it. Since they are the veggie eaters at the table they got a thin crust veggie pizza and I ordered the fish taco. My wife liked the pizza, but mom was not so impressed. Fish taco was not the best but not the worst. They cud have atleast served 3 tacos instead of 2 tacos and ships adn salsa. On the whole it was an ok experience given so many issues before dinner.
15 mins to serve water. Another 10 mins to take order and another 30 mins and no food yet. About to leave the place

Not a very good experience. Our server never brought us bread or checked on us. Everyone seemed to be on there phones or standing around talking. Salad was ok but not for $15!!! Absolutely a rip off. When we left the hostess was standing there talking to another employee and didn't even acknowledge us. Will not be coming back again. Such a shame.

I like the location of this CPK. I've had two online order pickups and each time, the cashier was extremely friendly and helpful when I came to pick up my order. I've also dined in twice; the first time was fine but the second was rather disappointing. I think I'll stick to online ordering. I'm addicted to their Quinoa and Arugula salad. I don't know what it is; but I crave it constantly. I've tried recreating it with little success, so I don't mine forking over the $10 or so on occasion as a treat to myself. I've also had their Margherita pizza, which was fabulous (first time trying CPK). I was alone, and was seated at a high-top table near the bar, which was fine. Server was great and I got set up with their Pizza Dough rewards card.  One my second dine in experience, the bf and I were seated in a booth. I had their Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. It was delicious, except my experience was ruined by our inattentive waitress. She was more concerned with socializing with her regulars seated about 3 tables away. It took me three tries and waiting 20 minutes for a water refill. It was a Sunday afternoon and hardly anyone was in the restaurant. Yet we were also seated by a group of three men who were talking loudly and generally being disruptive. There's no reason to talk that loud when there's 5 other parties dining in.  Overall I don't care to dine in there, but as I said, I've had no issues with my online ordering. So, I'll stick to that and keep away from the terrible waitstaff and ignorant patrons.

We been coming to this cpk location for a while and food is always really good, and also service never disappoints but this occasion Jonah was our server and his service was great ! Very friendly and attentive. Thank you Jonah for great serv

We have visited often but not for about 3 mths now. Wow. What a change. Avocado brown in salad. Dirty dishes in our face at bar. No bread. Eventually water. Tvs terrible although that's not why we came. Very disappointed.

Terrible experience; we had 2 coupons, but they did not honor the second one. We ordered chicken quesadilla appetizers which were dry and tasteless to us. They were pricey as well. Will not visit again.
Excellent food,  great atmosphere,  we'll trained staff,  friendly bartenders!  I miss Bobby,  by the way! :)

Tostada pizza was very sparse on the toppings compared to other CPK locations I have had it at. Service was overall very poor, had to beg and flag down waitress for drink refills. Waited forever for our pizzas, and was told they " stuck to the oven" and had to be re made. Huh????? Don't expect them to comp anything for their screw up, though. They certainly won't,  another reason service here is 1 star.

Went back today and had a completely different experience then last time. This time they made us feel very welcome, brought bread and olive oil to the table and the service was very friendly and attentive. Back to my old California Pizza Kitchen!

Very slow service. This not the first time but this time we really got pissed and had to walk out and go somewhere because the kids were super hungry and after 15 minutes of waiting no body turned up to take our orders. They were not that busy either and seems like a bunch of distraught and frustrated workforce. Our kids still love their food so probably we will be back there soon but I am hoping they hear us and things are better next time.

We used to be this place and it was good. However we haven't been there for few months and something must be changed. Tonight, we sat there for 20 minutes without any service. Then I need to talk to someone to find who can help us to make order. It took quite long to get the food, even though it was not crowded (like 6-8 tables or so). Not sure if we will come back.

I came here with my kids. I'm not sure if it's a super family friendly place, but we didn't feel out of place by any measure. I ordered the four cheese ravioli. My eldest daughter ordered Macaroni and Cheese from the child's menu. My other daughter decided she wasn't very hungry so we would share my adult portion of raviolis. My husband ordered the Jambalaya pasta.  The server was very friendly, however he wasn't very comfortable with the kids. He asked them very awkward questions. No points taken off though because some people just don't have a way with kids. I get that. The food came fast. My husband and eldest daughter both enjoyed their meals. They said the taste and portion sizes were perfect! Mine however, was a tiny portion. There were maybe 8 raviolis total. More sauce than anything else. My daughter had a bigger portion of macaroni and cheese from the children's menu. I had her split it my younger daughter because there was no way I was going to be able to fill hers and my belly on my dish. It wasn't very tasty either. Overall. it was an "just okay" kind of experience. I probably won't be back. Rock Bottom is next door and they are comparable in price, but hugher in quality.

This place is pretty great. The Spinach Artichoke dip is delicious, the hummus is delicious, and most of their pastas are delicious too. I especially like the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. My only down side of CPK is that the red sauce on the pizzas is always too sweet. I think the dough is also too sweet. Lastly, it is WAY TOO COLD all the time and I have no idea why. There's always a cold breeze and I can never take my coat off and warm up here. Weird.

I eat at CPKs all over and they are usually so consistent I don't even review them. This one was pretty bad. I walked in at about 7:45 and the bar was empty but totally trashed. Literally no place for one person to sit that was clean. The bartender was nice enough but took forever to come back after he dropped the menus. I think the guy was the only bartender on and was doing his best. I ordered the bbq chicken pizza (which I always get) and the crust was so soggy I couldn't pick it up. Aren't they known for their pizza? I had waited long enough so I just dealt with it. I got the impression that the manager would not have helped anyway. 3 tables had issues while I sat at the bar. At one point he told a table that had a complaint "whatever".
Extremely slow service, doughy pizza, brought the wrong salad. I'm not going back. huge disappointment.

I had a wonderful lunch here today. The food: We had a white pizza and a California veggie on honey wheat crust. They were both scrumptious but I enjoyed the veggie a bit more since it had more ingredients (like mushrooms, roasted eggplant, baby asparagus, and red onions) and packed more flavor into each bite than the white. The beverage: I tried something new to drink: mango iced tea. They take normal ice tea and add in sweetened flavored syrups.  They had several varieties (peach, raspberry, and another one too), but I am so happy I tried the mango.   ** Sidenote: It tastes a lot like CBTL's Mucho Mango (my favorite beverage on the planet), so you can imagine how happy I was since I normally have to travel 2,000 miles to get one of those. ** The service: Bonnie was wonderful - very helpful in making our pizza selection and attentive throughout the entire meal.  Perfect in every way! Misc:  The entire place was spotless, especially the bathroom.  Bravo.

Pair a flavor separatist like me, whose palette is overwhelmed by anything beyond bread + tomatoes + cheese, with my friend who creates the most unusual -- and delightful -- culinary creations imaginable, and you have hilarity. Who knew artichoke, mushroom and pineapple pizza was made all the better by scooping on guacamole? My visit this afternoon was rather lovely, greeted by a fun, cute and super caring hostess who chatted with me and recommended some awesome seasonal specials. The waiter was a bit scattered, but it was during lunch rush, so that's to be expected. My cheese pizza was a bit too greasy for my tastes, even after dabbing it with a napkin, but the crust had a savory hint of butter and the flavors were balanced delicately. A thin-crust pizza has to work damn hard to earn a recommendation from a die-hard deep dish fan like me, but it won me over in the end. One bit of advice? Don't you dare walk out that door without dessert. The super-sized portions are worth every penny (and calorie). I had my first taste of cheesecake ever, which tasted like it was made with real pumpkin, and my friend scooped up every last morsel of the red velvet cake. He said it was the best he'd ever had. My envious eyes (and stomach) are eagerly waiting their turn on another trip. Also of note: this is the perfect place to bring folks with food allergies. The menu notes gluten-free options, and the online menu is super helpful for vegetarians. I've never before seen a restaurant specify by lacto-ovo, vegan, and every permutation in between!

This place is terrible, starting with the wait time to the time bill came. My girlfriend and I came here one Saturday night which was our first mistake, the place was packed with long wait times. Once we were seated our waiter arrived, and he reminded me of Pauly D from the jersey shore, very fake and and annoying. The prices here are outrageous, especially for mediocre pizza. I got the gluten free pizza and it tasted like cardboard, avid what it worse was the price 16 bucks for a small personal pizza!! The girlfriend got Martini and it was almost the price of her pizza, now I'm not a cheapskate by any means, but if your going to charge an arm and a leg for your service I better leave happy and satisfied which i did not. I'll be contacting CPK to complain as well. Will not be back.

I've decided that the food is OK. I've been more impressed at other CPKs, but this one isn't horrible. I think the service is better than the pizza. The few times I've been to this location the hostesses are friendly and efficient, the servers are fun and have never messed up an order. Only real complaint is that refills often take longer than one would like. I understand when they are busy. I don't always want a refill right away and will turn it down, but it doesn't hurt to ask again later if we've been sitting a while.
